Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the success of the Recovery Act by stating that $174 billion has been committed in its first 130 days, when the actual amount is slightly less at $157.8 billion.
Understate: The claim may be understating the amount of money that has been allocated so far by stating that only 35% of the spending has been allocated, when Republican critics argue that only 6.8% of the stimulus package has been spent.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support for the stated amount of $174 billion being committed in the first 130 days of the Recovery Act.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or perspectives, such as the criticism from Republican critics that the money is trickling out slowly.
